It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has small, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. It is often found in forest floors and rocky crevices, where it contributes to soil stabilization and nutrient cycling. Phlegmariurus merrillii plays an important ecological role in maintaining the health of moist, temperate ecosystems.
